page.title: 02Oldmeldrum
page.content: Oldmeldrum is a market town surrounded by prime farming land. Its name is a corruption of the Pictish Celt Allt meall druim, meaning the burn by the rise on the hill. With the development of oil exploration in the 1970s, Oldmeldrum became a dormitory town - half the male population working on oil rigs in the North Sea or in oil- related industries in Aberdeen. It has retained its market character, in spite of a rise of one-third in population between 1980 and 1985. New housing has been added on the fringes of the town, maintaining the oldest 18th Century buildings within the conservation area which focusses on the Square and Town Hall. East of the town the Pleasure Park host Oldmeldrum Sports held for the last 50 years. Proceeds from this gala of highland games to to local sports groups.
